name: Tryp Condal Mar

reviews.title: Great value for money
reviews.text: We've just returned from a 5 day trip to Barcelona and stayed at this hotel, we all loved it. Yes, the location is slightly out of town, and the area is being developed, but it was a beautiful hotel and is excellent value for money. The staff were very pleasant and spoke english, breakfast was fine for a cold buffet and the rooms were spotless. If you like the minimalistic style and are looking for a modern and clean hotel but don't want the city centre price tag then I highly recommend it.

Wow, what a hotel. This is a beautifully designed hotel, where care and attention has been given to the design from the foyer, upwards. The circular design adds to an intriguing room design, but this doesn't mean the rooms are small by any standards. The room had all the mod cons you would want, except only one 1 English language TV channel (CNN), not that it really mattered to me, but it may to others. The breakfast was a feast, with plenty of variety all for 14 euros. The area outside the hotel was a bit strange as it was away from the hustle and bustle of the city, clearly in the old industrial zone of the city. The area was desolate, but was well lit and you always felt safe walking around in the early hours. The journey from the airport took about 35 mins in a taxi and cost in the region of 28 euros, which wasn't too bad. Alternatively you could take the Aerobus (from the Airport) to Placa Catalyuna and walk (5 mins) to Urquinaona on the L4 (yellow line) and then take the metro from there to Selva De Mar; (you can also take the metro to Catalyuna, but this will mean you need to change which means more walking if you have heavy bags). This will take you around 20-25 mins and will save you some money. The journey on the aerobus is only 3.75 euros and a metro journey single costs only 1 euro (so I'm told). It’s cheaper to get a T10 book which will give you 10 single journeys for around €7, which is what I did. Even though the hotel is not local, you can get into the centre of Barcelona in around 20-30 mins depending where you go. The bonus is that you do get to stay in a great hotel for less than a usual 4 star hotel in the city. The staff was polite and spoke great English and helped make my first time in Barcelona a memorable one.
reviews.title: Modern Design at the Vincci.
Fabulous hotel!!!
reviews.text: We've just returned form a trip from Barcelona and stayed in the Hotel Vincci Condal Mar. We'd recommend this hotel to our friends and family. It's pretty modern and it's nice that it's located just outside the crowdy centre of Barcelona. It takes you no longer than 5 minutes to get to Metro 'Selva de Mar'. (If it took you longer you must have been walking backwards...) The rooms are beautufully furnished, they're clean and breakfast is great. The view from the top op the hotel is amazing!! We enjoyed our stay in this hotel very much. Have fun in Barcelona!!

reviews.title: Very mod,with cool bathroom door/wall
reviews.text: This Hotel Is certainly value for money.4 star,modern and a great buffet breakfast.the problem that some might have that the nearest metro(which runs every 5 mins)is ten minutes walk away with another 10-15 min ride into the city.the hotel is based in an industral area which means after 5.30pm its get very quiet and very weiry for walking alone.bottom line would I go back? most definitly
Do not believe everything you read on this web site about this hotel, i agree that the hotel is not in the most glam part of the city, infact we could see 19 cranes out of our bedroom window!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, give it a chance

reviews.text: I have just returned from 4 nights at this hotel and would like to warn those who read this site.
reviews.title: Take Care

reviews.text: The location is opposite a coffee warehouse and 100 yards from a Gypsy caravan site. The 'shopping centre' referred to as being close by is a sprawl of tenement blocks with occasional tapas bars and barricaded shops amongst them.
reviews.title: Loved the Con Del Mar
Average stay
reviews.text: I stayed at Vincci Condal Mar for 6 nights in June 06.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: The Hotel is fine well kept and the Reception and Rooms modern Air conditioned and spotless, the Buffet breakfast was fine and offered a reasonable variety.

reviews.title: Fantastic... Ideally located
reviews.text: That is the better parts of the review, the Hotel service is quite poor getting served at the rooftop Pool (which is mobbed if more than ten people are at it ) Bar is almost impossible as it gets staffed for about 5 mins every Hr, do not get fooled by the website claim of view the city by night as the rooftop gets shut just as darkness descends?.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a lovely lobby and magnificent lights hanging from the ceiling, which gives an overall good first impression. The rooms are above average with a HUGE bed, nice TV and bathroom. The only downside is there is only one English channel - but still, not a big thing unless you are planning to stay in the room all day! The selection of room service is not great, and neither is the lunch-time option in the restaraunt, but the food you do get is excellent. The separate restaraunt "Takenmori" has amazing food, although quite expensive; about €80 for a meal for two! It is well worth it though. The bar in the lobby also shuts at 11 so we didn't even get a chance to try it!
reviews.title: OK, but not great
Nothing special
reviews.text: One major drawback is the size of the pool - absolutely tiny and not heated. The views from the roof are quite spectacular, especially at night, however, they do shut the terrace round about 10.30 - 11, so you don't get to see much of them. The staff at the hotel, although being far from rude and unhelpful, are quite unfriendly and speak very little english.
having read the reviews before hand i was also worried about my stay. this was totally unfounded.
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is too far away from central barcelona. We booked it as it looked like a nice boutique hotel with a pool at a great price... but the cost and time to travel to port olimpic, plaza catalunya and las ramblas, for example, (10-15 euros in taxi, 20 euros to top of diagonal/tres torres area) made it expensive. It would have been better to pay slightly more for a room in a central hotel. Also if you get the hotel to book you a cab, there'll be a callout charge already on the clock of 1.55 to 4 euros.
reviews.title: Bad location and service

likes.liked: — The pool (though pool bar was never open!)

reviews.text: The surrounding area is underdeveloped, quiet, industrial and not a pleasant walk (10 mins or so) to the metro and tram - definitely not at night. There are people living in shacks on rooftops around and the general area doesn't feel secure.
reviews.title: Want to stay in Beirut???
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Also, we had a problem in our room and it was handled really badly and rudely by the staff and not resolved.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed in the Vincci Condal Mar as part of a wedding group. I have to say that although we were upgraded to a beautiful room, which I could not complain about at all, I was a little disappointed with the service we received. The hotel residents bar closed at 11pm every evening, and more often than not you were likely to be waiting on some occasions, for up to 30 minutes for a bar person to arrive to pour the drinks!!
reviews.title: Great hotel, shame about the location

reviews.text: On our second day my hand bag was stolen right outside the hotel door, the reception staff then proceeded to give us directions to a police station that would not take a statement from me! So they were of no help at all.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but bad location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: although the hotel was comfortable, it was too remote,
reviews.title: very dangerous location

reviews.text: we was advised by people on this site to use the metro during the day and taxi by night.
reviews.title: Friendly, modern and great value
Fantastic Find!
reviews.text: on our last night our taxi driver tried to mug us by pepper spraying and beating us and abandoned us five minutes from the hotel.

I didn't want to have to write this, but must warn other people attracted by the pictures on the website. Yes, the hotel is stunning, but the area it's in is little more than a slum, and very dangerous. The scary place with people living on the roof is still across the road.
reviews.title: Steer well clear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotels' security is also lax, although they were quick to pounce on us when we went for breakfast.
reviews.title: Luxury at a fraction of the In-Town Costs - A little planning needed.

likes.disliked: — I knew about the location, so nothing.

description: The Tryp Hotel Condal Mar is one of the most modern hotels in Barcelona.
